en.Implementa: Implement the agriculture of the future in your life
en.Cultiva: Grow today, sustain tomorrow, Sustainability is the key
en.Transforma: Transform you land with smart technology and responsible practices
en.Menos-descripcion: Reduce the use of chemical products to control pests and diseases, prioritizing more natural methods that are less harmful to the environment. Biological control, which involves the use of insects that combat pests or resistant crops to withstand pests and diseases.
en.Menos2-descripcion: Use practical technologies that optimize water use, such as drip irrigation or rainwater harvesting, to prevent waste and maintain efficiency while ensuring the long-term availability of water resources.
en.rendimiento-descripcion: Maximize crop production using practices that do not harm and protect the environment, with the use of organic fertilizers and crop rotation, to increase the quality and quantity of the harvest.
en.Cultivando-el-Futuro: Cultivating the Future: Innovation at the Service of the Planet
en.Culti-descripcion1:
In the era of technology, agriculture is evolving like never before. Advances in artificial intelligence, drones, smart sensors, and precision techniques are revolutionizing the way we grow our food.

Discover how these innovations not only increase efficiency and productivity but also protect our environment, reduce resource waste, and promote sustainable agricultural practices for future generations.

Explore our Innovation Projects and join the transformation of the field towards a cleaner, smarter, and more resilient future.
en.Empodera-tu-campo: Empower your Field: Practical Resources for Sustainable and Successful Agriculture
en.Empo-descripcion1:
Do you want to improve your crops, save water, and increase your productivity without compromising the environment? In this section, you will find practical guides, expert advice, and materials designed specifically to help you implement innovative and sustainable techniques in your daily life.

üå± Optimize your resources : Learn to use water, land, and energy efficiently.
üí° Innovation within reach : Discover modern tools that will make your work easier and more profitable.
üåç Care for the planet : Apply practices that protect the environment while boosting your business.
en.Historias-que-inspiran: Inspiring Stories: Farmers Transforming Their Future with Innovation
en.Histo-descripcion1:
Discover how farmers like you are revolutionizing their work through innovative techniques and sustainable practices. These real stories will show you how technology, knowledge, and creativity can turn challenges into opportunities.

üåæ From tradition to the future : Meet those who have adopted new technologies to increase their productivity without losing their connection to the land.
üíß Smart solutions : Stories of farmers who optimized water use and reduced costs while protecting the environment.
üåç Positive impact : Success stories where sustainability benefited not only crops but also local communities and ecosystems.
en.ForosSeccion: Connect, Share, Grow: Join Our Global Community of Farmers
en.ForosSeccion-descripcion:
Do you want to be a part of a conversation that is transforming the agriculture's future? In our forums, all farmers of the world meet for share experiences, resolv challenges and explore latest innovation at the fields.

üë• Build global connections : Meet different region farmers and cultures who confront similar challenges as yours.
üí°Learn about professionals and people as you: Paticipate at deliberations with professionals and other farmers that are implementing innovation solutions.
üå± Inspire with new ideas : Discover trendings,
en.error-filtro: You can only select up to 3 filters
en.Innovacion-riego-descripcion: Smart irrigation allows optimizing water use through sensors, timers, and data analysis. These systems detect soil moisture and weather conditions to supply only the necessary amount of water, reducing waste and improving crop yield.
en.innovacion-fertilizantes-descripcion: Ecological fertilizers, made from organic and natural materials, offer a sustainable alternative to chemical products. They contribute to soil health, promote healthy plant growth, and reduce environmental impact.
en.Innovacion-rotacion-descripcion: Crop rotation is an agricultural practice that involves changing the type of crop in a given plot over different seasons. This helps improve soil fertility, control pests and diseases, and prevent nutrient degradation.
en.Innovacion-vertical-descripcion: Vertical farming is based on cultivating in stacked structures or closed urban spaces, using technology such as LED lights and hydroponic systems. This technique allows maximizing space, reducing water use, and producing food closer to consumption centers.
en.Innovacion-Bioinsumos-descripcion: Bioinputs use living organisms, plant extracts, or minerals to control pests and diseases. They are a natural alternative to pesticides, helping to protect crops without harming the ecosystem or affecting human health.
en.Innovacion-Cultivos-descripcion: Thanks to biotechnology and genetic research, crops are being developed that can withstand extreme conditions such as droughts, high temperatures, or saline soils. This ensures a more stable production adapted to the effects of climate change.
en.categorias-error: There are no articles matching the selected categories.
en.Recursos-guia: Basic guide to optimize water use
en.Recursos-ahorrar: Discover how to save water in your crops by implementing simple practices such as watering early in the morning, using ground cover to retain moisture, and adjusting the amount of water according to the specific needs of each plant.
en.Recursos-aprende: Learn to plan your planting according to the seasons and climate. Know which crops thrive in spring, summer, fall, and winter to maximize your productivity throughout the year.
en.Recursos-manten: Keep your soil healthy and fertile with accessible methods such as crop rotation, using homemade organic fertilizer, and covering with plant residues to prevent erosion and retain nutrients.
en.Recursos-identificar: How to identify common pests and control them
en.Recursos-detecta: Detect the most common pests in your crops and learn to combat them naturally using repellent plants, beneficial insects, and other ecological solutions that protect your plants without harming the environment.
en.Recursos-reducir: Tips to reduce food waste after harvest
en.Recursos-evita: Avoid post-harvest losses with simple practices such as storing products in cool, dry places, using airtight containers, and planning distribution to ensure your food reaches the market fresh.
en.Recursos-optimiza: Optimize your space and improve the balance of your field by planting complementary plants together. For example, combine corn with beans or onions with carrots to take advantage of their mutual benefits and increase your production.
en.Historias-sub: From savings on inputs to improvements in soil quality: these are the impacts of applying innovation in agriculture.
en.Historias-sub2: Agricultural practices have borne fruite in:
en.Historias-dat1: Reduces pesticides used by up to 30% compared to conventional practices.
en.Historias-dat2: Saves between 20% and 60% of water with efficient irrigation systems such as drip irrigation.
en.Historias-dat3: Decreases soil erosions by up to 50% thanks to techniques like crop rotation.
en.Historias-dat4: Boosts biodiversity up to 2 times more than industrial monocultures.
en.Historias-dat5: Reduces greenhouses gas emisions by up to 40% in certain systems.
en.Historias-dat6: Improvees long-term soil fertility, lowering the need for synthetic fertilizers.
en.Historias-dat7: Supports local economies and increases small farmers' incomes.
en.Historias-dat8: Protects pollinators like bees, which are essential for food security.
en.Historias-sub3: Stories Where Sustainable Agriculture was applied:
en.Historias-h1: The "Zero Budget Nature Farming" project has tranformed agriculture by teaching millions of farmers natural, chemical-free practices such as fermentation and green manures. This has reduced operating costs by up to 80% and improved soil quality, while also increasing yields and rural economic stability.
en.Historias-h2: Indigenous small-scale farmers have adopted agroforestry systems that combine cacao with fruit and timber trees, restoring ecosystems, improving water retention, and doubling incomes through certified organic products‚Äîall while helping mitigate climate change.
en.Historias-h3: Gabe Brown has implemented regenerative agriculture using crop rotation, cover crops, and managed grazing. This has increased soil organic matter, reduced costs by 75%, and improved profitability through diversification and direct-to-consumer sales.
en.Historias-h4: Faced with limited space, vertical farming using hydroponic and aeroponic systems has been developed, consuming 90% less water. This has reduced the carbon footprint, created specialized jobs, and improved food security in urban environments.
en.Historias-h5: Coffee producers have implemented sustainable practices such as biodigesters, reforestation, and shading, achieving a 25% reduction in emissions, certifying over 10,000 hectares, and improving prices through organic production, thereby strengthening the local economy.
en.Historias-h6: The COOPFAM cooperative has adopted agroecology through the integration of crops, livestock, and resource management. This has increased biodiversity by 60% and strengthened land resilience, demonstrating that environmentally respectful production is possible.
en.Historias-h7: The company Full Harvest has created a digital marketplace to sell imperfect or surplus agricultural products, preventing millions of pounds of food waste each year, increasing farmers' income, and promoting awareness about food utilization.

es.Innovacion-riego-descripcion: El riego inteligente permite optimizar el uso del agua mediante sensores, temporizadores y an√°lisis de datos. Estos sistemas detectan la humedad del suelo y las condiciones clim√°ticas para suministrar solo la cantidad necesaria de agua, reduciendo el desperdicio y mejorando el rendimiento de los cultivos.
es.innovacion-fertilizantes-descripcion: Los fertilizantes ecol√≥gicos, elaborados a partir de materiales org√°nicos y naturales, ofrecen una alternativa sostenible a los productos qu√≠micos. Contribuyen a la salud del suelo, promueven el crecimiento saludable de las plantas y reducen el impacto ambiental.
es.Innovacion-rotacion-descripcion: La rotaci√≥n de cultivos es una pr√°ctica agr√≠cola que consiste en cambiar el tipo de cultivo en una misma parcela durante diferentes temporadas. Esto ayuda a mejorar la fertilidad del suelo, controlar plagas y enfermedades, y evitar la degradaci√≥n de los nutrientes.
es.Innovacion-vertical-descripcion: La agricultura vertical se basa en cultivar en estructuras apiladas o en espacios urbanos cerrados, utilizando tecnolog√≠a como luz LED y sistemas hidrop√≥nicos. Esta t√©cnica permite aprovechar al m√°ximo el espacio, reducir el uso de agua y producir alimentos m√°s cerca de los centros de consumo.
es.Innovacion-Bioinsumos-descripcion: Los bioinsumos utilizan organismos vivos, extractos vegetales o minerales para controlar plagas y enfermedades. Son una alternativa natural a los pesticidas, ayudando a proteger los cultivos sin da√±ar el ecosistema ni afectar la salud humana.
es.Innovacion-Cultivos-descripcion: Gracias a la biotecnolog√≠a y la investigaci√≥n gen√©tica, se desarrollan cultivos capaces de resistir condiciones extremas como sequ√≠as, altas temperaturas o suelos salinos. Esto asegura una producci√≥n m√°s estable y adaptada a los efectos del cambio clim√°tico.

es.Historias-sub2: El uso de la agicultura ha dado frutos en:
es.Historias-dat1: Reducir hasta un 30% el uso de pesticidas comparado con pr√°cticas convencionales.
es.Historias-dat2: Ahorrar entre un 20% y 60% de agua con sistemas de riego eficientes como el goteo.

es.Historias-sub3: Historias donde se aplic√≥ la agricultura sostenible:
es.Historias-h1: El proyecto "Zero Budget Natural Farming" ha transformado la agricultura al ense√±ar a millones de agricultores pr√°cticas naturales sin productos qu√≠micos, como fermentaci√≥n y abonos verdes. Esto ha reducido costos operativos hasta en un 80% y mejorado la calidad del suelo, adem√°s de aumentar los rendimientos y la estabilidad econ√≥mica rural.
es.Historias-h2: Peque√±os agricultores ind√≠genas han adoptado sistemas agroforestales que combinan cacao con √°rboles frutales y maderables, restaurando ecosistemas, mejorando la retenci√≥n de agua y duplicando ingresos con productos org√°nicos certificados, al tiempo que ayudan a mitigar el cambio clim√°tico.
es.Historias-h3: Gabe Brown ha implementado agricultura regenerativa con rotaci√≥n de cultivos, cobertura vegetal y pastoreo controlado, lo cual ha aumentado la materia org√°nica del suelo, reducido costos en un 75% y mejorado la rentabilidad al diversificar y vender directamente a consumidores.
es.Historias-h4: Frente a la falta de espacio, se han desarrollado cultivos verticales usando sistemas hidrop√≥nicos y aerop√≥nicos que consumen 90% menos agua. Esto ha reducido la huella de carbono, generado empleos especializados y mejorado la seguridad alimentaria en entornos urbanos.
es.Historias-h5: Productores de caf√© han implementado pr√°cticas sostenibles como biodigestores, reforestaci√≥n y sombreado, logrando reducir un 25% las emisiones de gases, certificar m√°s de 10,000 hect√°reas y mejorar los precios gracias a la producci√≥n org√°nica, fortaleciendo la econom√≠a local.
es.Historias-h6: La cooperativa COOPFAM ha adoptado la agroecolog√≠a con integraci√≥n de cultivos, ganader√≠a y gesti√≥n de recursos, aumentando la biodiversidad en un 60% y fortaleciendo la resiliencia de la tierra, mostrando que es posible producir de forma respetuosa con el ambiente.
es.Historias-h7: La empresa Full Harvest ha creado un mercado digital para vender productos agr√≠colas imperfectos o excedentes, evitando millones de libras de desperdicio alimentario al a√±o, aumentando los ingresos de agricultores y promoviendo la conciencia sobre el aprovechamiento de alimentos.
